trans-unit.source: Represents a key identifier clause that identifies a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken"></xref> or <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosReceiverSecurityToken"></xref> security token.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosTicketHashKeyIdentifierClause> class to reference a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken> or <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosReceiverSecurityToken> security token using a SHA-1 hash of the Kerberos ticket.
The SHA-1 hash of the Kerberos ticket can be obtained by calling the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosTicketHashKeyIdentifierClause.GetKerberosTicketHash%2A> method.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosTicketHashKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> class using the specified SHA-1 hash of a Kerberos service ticket.
An array of <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> that contains the SHA-1 hash of a Kerberos service ticket.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosTicketHashKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> class using the specified Kerberos ticket, nonce, and key length.
The [!INCLUDE[vsindigo](~/includes/vsindigo-md.md)] does not support the creation of implied derived key identifiers.
However, [!INCLUDE[vsindigo](~/includes/vsindigo-md.md)] processes and consumes incoming SOAP messages that contain implied derived key identifiers.
An array of <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> that contains the SHA-1 hash of a Kerberos service ticket.
An array of <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> that contains the nonce that was used to create a derived key.
The size of the derived key.
Gets the SHA-1 hash of a Kerberos service ticket.
An array of <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> that contains the SHA-1 hash of a Kerberos service ticket.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosTicketHashKeyIdentifierClause.ToString%2A> method returns the SHA-1 hash of a Kerberos service ticket.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that represents the current object.
